title: Funny Jokes to Tell Your Boyfriend

steps.title: “Why do bees hum? They can’t remember the lyrics.”[3] X Research source
steps.content: “Why do bees hum? They can’t remember the lyrics.” [3] X Research source

steps.title: “What does a spy do when they get cold? They go undercover.”
steps.content: “What does a spy do when they get cold? They go undercover.”

steps.title: “Why did the coach go to the bank? To get his quarterback.”
steps.content: “Why did the coach go to the bank? To get his quarterback.”

steps.title: “What do you call a pony with a cough? A little hoarse.”
steps.content: “What do you call a pony with a cough? A little hoarse.”

steps.title: “What do you call 2 birds in love? Tweet-hearts.”
steps.content: “What do you call 2 birds in love? Tweet-hearts.”

steps.title: “Why is a boat a good place for a first date? It’s perfect for a little row-mance.”
steps.content: “Why is a boat a good place for a first date? It’s perfect for a little row-mance.”

steps.title: “What did the cat say to her boyfriend? We’re purr-fect together.”
steps.content: “What did the cat say to her boyfriend? We’re purr-fect together.”

steps.title: “What did the barista say to their crush? I like you a latte!”
steps.content: “What did the barista say to their crush? I like you a latte!”

steps.title: “What did the stamp say to the envelope? I’m stuck on you.”
steps.content: “What did the stamp say to the envelope? I’m stuck on you.”

steps.title: “What did the light bulb say to the switch? You know how to turn me on.”[4] X Research source
steps.content: “What did the light bulb say to the switch? You know how to turn me on.” [4] X Research source

steps.title: “Do you know what your shirt is made from? Boyfriend material.”
steps.content: “Do you know what your shirt is made from? Boyfriend material.”

steps.title: “Life without you is like a broken pencil…pointless.”
steps.content: “Life without you is like a broken pencil…pointless.”

steps.title: “What’s on the menu tonight? Me-n-u!”
steps.content: “What’s on the menu tonight? Me-n-u!”

steps.title: “I’m not a photographer, but I’m picturing us together right now.”
steps.content: “I’m not a photographer, but I’m picturing us together right now.”

steps.title: “It sounds cheesy, but I think you’re really grate!”
steps.content: “It sounds cheesy, but I think you’re really grate!”

steps.title: “Even though we’re not socks, we still make a great pair!”
steps.content: “Even though we’re not socks, we still make a great pair!”

steps.title: “Are you a keyboard? Because you’re definitely my type.”[5] X Research source
steps.content: “Are you a keyboard? Because you’re definitely my type.” [5] X Research source

steps.title: “Is your name Earl Gray? Because you’re definitely a hot-tea!”
steps.content: “Is your name Earl Gray? Because you’re definitely a hot-tea!”

steps.title: “Are you French? Because Eiffel for you.”
steps.content: “Are you French? Because Eiffel for you.”

steps.title: “Are you a beaver? ‘Cause dam!”
steps.content: “Are you a beaver? ‘Cause dam!”

steps.title: “Are you a pie? Because I want a piece of you.”
steps.content: “Are you a pie? Because I want a piece of you.”

steps.title: “Do you know how to fish? Because you’ve got me hooked.”
steps.content: “Do you know how to fish? Because you’ve got me hooked.”

steps.title: “Are you tired from running through my mind all day?”
steps.content: “Are you tired from running through my mind all day?”

steps.title: “You’re a criminal because you’ve stolen my heart!”[6] X Research source
steps.content: “You’re a criminal because you’ve stolen my heart!” [6] X Research source

steps.title: “Is it hot in here? Or is it just you?”
steps.content: “Is it hot in here? Or is it just you?”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Kiss. Kiss who? Kiss me, silly!”
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Kiss. Kiss who? Kiss me, silly!”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Olive. Olive who? Olive you!”
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Olive. Olive who? Olive you!”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Honeydew. Honeydew who? Honeydew you know how much I love you?”
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Honeydew. Honeydew who? Honeydew you know how much I love you?”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Water. Water who? Water you doing later tonight?”
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Water. Water who? Water you doing later tonight?”

steps.title: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Aisle. Aisle who? Aisle always be yours!”[7] X Research source
steps.content: “Knock knock. Who’s there? Aisle. Aisle who? Aisle always be yours!” [7] X Research source
